definition: stone rubbing (to copy an inscription)
to expand/to push sth with the hand/to develop/to open up
to make a rubbing (e.g. of an inscription)
surname Tuo
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: Some people made ink rubbings of their loved ones’ names, often on the official event program.
sentences.chinese: 许多人将至亲的名字拓印下来。

sentences.english: Rubbings have been made from the majority of stone tablets here.
sentences.chinese: 这座碑林里的大部分石碑都已经拓印完毕。

sentences.english: Conclusion The fingerprints transferred can be identified by means of discerning their characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 结论通过特征分析可以对薄膜拓印指纹进行检验。

sentences.english: There are some transitional effects. At the very beginning I think it is lithographic print.
sentences.chinese: 有一些过渡的效果，我一开始还以为拓印的版画呢。

sentences.english: Unknown chapters appeared from the come-and-go days.
sentences.chinese: 来去的年华，露出未曾拓印的章节。

sentences.english: Is it lithographic or handmade-painting that you put to use?
sentences.chinese: 您是用拓印的还是手工绘画？

sentences.english: Some used pencils and crayons to make rubbings of the names.
sentences.chinese: 有人用铅笔和蜡笔将亲人的名字从纪念碑上拓印下来。

definition: to engrave a seal/stamp mark/to print with carved type/to leave a deep impression
(Taoism) talisman in the form of a painting of symbols thought to have magical powers
carving a seal
surviving section of a classic work/remaining chapters (while reading a book)
records/book/Taoist written charm/book of prophecy (e.g. of dynastic fortunes)
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
scroll (book or painting)
charm/amulet (religious object conferring blessing)
seal/signet/chop/stamp/CL:方[fang1]
to make a copy of
catalog
to carve/to engrave/carving
seal (of office)/seal script (a calligraphic style)/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆/writing in seal script
extant fragment (of book)
imperial edict/heavenly book (superstition)/obscure or illegible writing/double dutch
(literary) personal letter
